verdict.summary: UnrecognizedPropertyException is thrown by Jackson when JSON contains a field that does not map to any property in the target Java class. By default, Jackson requires all JSON properties to have matching fields in the POJO.

dead_ends.action: Adding FAIL_ON_UNKNOWN_PROPERTIES = false globally to the ObjectMapper
dead_ends.why_fails: Disabling unknown property checking globally means all JSON deserialization silently ignores unexpected fields. This hides API contract violations, schema drift, and typos. If a required field is renamed in the JSON source, the Java field will silently get a null/default value instead of raising an error, causing subtle bugs.

dead_ends.action: Adding @JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true) to every POJO class without understanding which fields are expected
dead_ends.why_fails: While less destructive than the global setting, blanket ignoring on every class still masks schema evolution issues. If the JSON API adds a new required field, your application will silently ignore it. Use this annotation judiciously, only on classes where unknown fields are genuinely expected.

workarounds.action: Update the Java class to match the JSON structure by adding the missing field or using @JsonProperty to map different names
workarounds.how: 1. Read the error message to identify the unrecognized field name. 2. If the field should be mapped: add a matching Java field, or use @JsonProperty('json_field_name') to map it to an existing field with a different name. 3. If the field is truly not needed for this class, add @JsonIgnoreProperties({'specificField'}) to ignore only that field. 4. For snake_case to camelCase mapping, configure PropertyNamingStrategies.SNAKE_CASE on the ObjectMapper.

workarounds.action: Use @JsonAnySetter to capture unknown properties in a Map for flexible deserialization
workarounds.how: 1. Add a Map<String, Object> field to the class. 2. Annotate the setter with @JsonAnySetter: @JsonAnySetter public void setAdditionalProperty(String name, Object value) { this.additionalProperties.put(name, value); }. 3. This captures all unmapped JSON properties without losing data. 4. Pair with @JsonAnyGetter for symmetric serialization. 5. This pattern is useful for extensible APIs where new fields may be added over time.

leads_to.condition: when ignoreUnknown causes a required field to be null instead of populated
when Jackson deserializes a JSON field into the wrong Java type

preceded_by.condition: when Jackson cannot find a custom deserializer class
when custom ObjectMapper configuration bean fails to initialize

frequently_confused_with.distinction: UnrecognizedPropertyException is about JSON structure mismatch (unknown field name); ClassCastException during deserialization is about type mismatch (field exists but has wrong type)
